positioning.current:
Experienced technical communicator and leader with 11 years in technical writing and 10 years in full-stack development. I've written a wide variety of content, developed many technical content sites / features / systems, and managed writing and engineering teams.

I'm a writer who loves technology, an engineer who loves to communicate, and a leader who's passionate about making things better for both users and developers. Throughout my career, I've thrived at the intersection of technology and content, using a hands-on approach and technical expertise to craft clear, effective content to educate users and make docs an important part of the user experience.

byRole.technical_writer: Experienced technical communicator and leader with 11 years in technical writing and 10 years in full-stack development. I've written a wide variety of content, developed many technical content sites / features / systems, and managed writing and engineering teams.
byRole.technical_writing_manager: Experienced technical communicator and leader with 11 years in technical writing and 10 years in full-stack development. I've written a wide variety of content, developed many technical content sites / features / systems, and managed writing and engineering teams.
byRole.software_engineer: Software Engineering Leader with 13 years of experience in full stack development and 11 years in technical communication. I have successfully established, led, and scaled teams to support a variety of programs and organizations, ranging from growth engineering, developer experience/enablement, and experience design.
byRole.engineering_manager: Software Engineering Leader with 13 years of experience in full stack development and 11 years in technical communication. I have successfully established, led, and scaled teams to support a variety of programs and organizations, ranging from growth engineering, developer experience/enablement, and experience design.

valuePropositions: I pride myself on taking the time to dive deep on whatever I'm writing about
My approach to technical writing emphasizes a deep understanding of the subject matter
I am committed to thorough research and immersion in the topics I write about
I prioritized the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse, non-technical audiences
profile.professionalMission: I thrive on crafting elegant solutions that enhance usability and streamline operations. My strength lies in demystifying complex concepts, translating them into accessible knowledge. I'm fascinated by the ingenuity of technology, particularly in software development. My passion extends to architecting robust systems, whether through code or by optimizing human-process interactions.
uniqueSellingPoints: Technical writing expertise combined with hands-on engineering experience
Deep subject matter expertise gained through operational experience
Proven track record of translating complex technical concepts for diverse audiences
Experience managing both engineering and technical writing teams

experiences.title: Manager Developer Documentation
responsibilities: Lead distributed team of 6 programmer writers supporting 170,000+ Amazonians across 50+ developer tools, achieving 15% increase in ASBX-owned tool coverage and 100% coverage of recommended AI tools
Manage content-as-code system with open contribution & shared ownership model across 400+ contributors
Lead cross-functional stakeholder relationships with product management, training, marketing, engineering, and UX research teams
Serve on content steering committee for AWS-wide communications

achievements.description: Built AI-driven documentation platform with automated content generation, review tooling, and quality analytics for proactive content health monitoring
achievements.impact: Improved developer experience and content quality

achievements.description: Increased documentation feedback helpfulness from 54% to 75% while growing traffic to AI assisted development documentation from 2K to 50K unique users in 2025
Streamlined documentation processes, reducing content creation and review time by 33% to keep pace with rapid product development
Developed 3-year strategic roadmap for builder experience documentation, focusing on AI-driven contributor optimization and workflow-based content
achievements.impact: Strategic direction for team and platform

achievements.description: Established documentation standards and enablement plan for AI-assisted development, partnering with product management to provide practical guidance
achievements.impact: Created framework for AI documentation standards

achievements.description: Helped enable 90% increase in active SDEs using Amazon Q Developer tools, achieving 101% of goal (40.6k active SDEs, 67% of all Amazon SDEs) through documentation strategy, AI best practices guidance, and cross-functional stakeholder management to enable rapid content development and future in-depth documentation
achievements.impact: Directly contributed to major business metric success

achievements.description: Led migration of 1,300+ product announcements from blog to "What's New" documentation feature, establishing quality standards and tooling that shifted technical content culture among PMs and PMMs. Implemented author guidance ensuring every announcement (~3 per week) included actionable CTAs linking to training courses and feature documentation, making technical information more discoverable and maintainable for Amazon engineers.
achievements.impact: Transformed content strategy to prioritize customer discoverability and documentation quality over blog-style publishing, eliminating technical content fragmentation while providing Amazon engineers with centralized, up-to-date product information and clear pathways to learning resources.

achievements.description: Partnered with Knowledge Technology team around content stewardship initiative and goal to increase answer quality in generative AI knowledge applications. This involved discussion around how to measure / think about content and answer quality and how to operationalize user feedback/sentiment from Sage+ their generative AI application engineers use to ask questions related to software development at Amazon. This app is available in various surfaces in Amazon including Slack, Sage (the internal discussion forum like StackOverflow), Internal Search (internal search web app like Google), and Wiki.
achievements.impact: The Knowledge Tech team adjusted its success metric for answer quality to be a defect ratio rather than CSAT or % positive helpfulness ratio. They then segmented that off into defect ratio when documentation was used as primary source for the answer. Then they updated their algorithm to prefer or check our documentation corpus first when answering a question which resulted in a 30 percentage point decrease in the defect ratio for answers (meaning engineers were less likely to report that an answer was inaccurate, irrelevant, or bad in some way)

experiences.title: Manager, Software Engineering
experiences.industry: Tech - Information Technology, Application Performance Management / Observability
responsibilities: Led a distributed team of 6 engineers that develops the content tooling, sites, and services that power our open source docs & developer websites, as well as in-product help & onboarding system / features
Oversee content system for 500 unique contributors annually
Drive early feature / system design and architecture planning
Work closely with product management / leadership / design / other stakeholders to set strategy and team roadmap / priorities
Lead interviewing, coding exercises, hiring, onboarding, and mentoring of engineers with the goal of quickly making them productive and engaged members of the team
Establish and track team / system health, and key business metrics to define & ensure team success

achievements.description: Planned and launched New Relic UI help & messaging feature to help users onboard and get contextual help. Led to 20% increase in weekly active user retention
Led UI projects to improve user experience on sites (SUPR-Q scores over 4)
Led several projects around improving frontend performance (50% increase in site speed / largest contentful paint and 75% increase in cumulative layout shift)
Led scalability project for our websites to enable teams to quickly create new sites and content around important initiatives
Establish new, distributed team and scale it from 3 to 6 engineers (2 in India)

Co-led cross-functional initiative to optimize documentation site conversion funnel through strategic UI enhancements, A/B tested content, and in-product integrations, partnering with Technical Writing and Product teams to rapidly develop conversion-optimized components and in-depth tutorials.
achievements.impact: Increased account signups by 200% in one quarter from company's 2nd highest-trafficked public site, driving high-value user acquisition with highest data ingest rates and product adoption across all signup channels, directly contributing to revenue through paid tier conversions (>100GB data ingest threshold).

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.industry: Tech - Information Technology, Application Performance Management / Observability
responsibilities: Provide technical input into roadmap planning, prioritize backlog, prototype, scope and plan upcoming work
Develop coding standards and excellence in team code reviews
Improve internationalization system to scale reliably and to support adding full coverage of an additional language in days with machine translation
Develop new sites, product UI views, and system to support and program called Instant Observability (collection of quickstart bundles for users to start monitoring their software quickly)
Migrate Drupal site to "content as code" content system (Gatsby/React, GitHub) with automation for internationalization, syncing content via various services to New Relic's product UI

achievements.description: Helped lead project to migrate large documentation system from Drupal to custom built system (GitHub + Gatsby), improving contributor & developer experience, and saving company $45,000 / year
achievements.impact: Significant cost savings and improved developer experience

achievements.description: Designed innovative in-app help system prototype that secured CEO approval and full project funding; served as technical advisor during development
Launched Japanese documentation site with full coverage in record time, enabling critical market expansion
Increased user feedback collection by 400% through strategic redesign of feedback form interface
Developed A/B tests for UI features and content that optimized for account signups from developer and docs sites

experiences.title: Senior Technical Writer
experiences.industry: Tech - Information Technology, Application Performance Management / Observability
responsibilities: Write consistent, high quality technical documentation that included API reference, tutorials, user guides for New Relic products
Partner closely with Support, engineering teams, and product management to test installation, new features, and ascertain where customers frequently encounter problems
Develop Drupal based CMS for docs and learning sites

achievements.description: Established technical expertise across core product suite: New Relic Insights, PHP monitoring, Browser analytics, Alerts, and Infrastructure monitoring
achievements.impact: Became subject matter expert across multiple products

achievements.description: Support launch of several new products including New Relic Alerts, New Relic Browser, New Relic Synthetics, and countless new features

experiences.title: Senior Technical Writer
responsibilities: Write and manage high quality and consistent documentation for operations manuals, training guides, software/equipment guides, internal procedure and standards guides
Develop custom project management site in PHP and MySQL database, and other content tooling

achievements.description: Co-led overhaul of docs system to industry's first all digital system for all operating groups

experiences.title: Manager Technical Documentation
responsibilities: Manage a small technical documentation team and system
Write technical documentation for flight systems and operational manuals
Prepare annual / monthly compliance reports to leadership

projects.name: New Relic for PHP guide
projects.overview: This sample is an adapted subset of web pages from docs.newrelic.com around how to install and configure the New Relic PHP agent.
projects.challenge: PHP was the most widely utilized but complex to install. Through discussions with technical support personnel, PHP agent engineers, and my personal hands-on experience with PHP, I identified areas for improvement and rewrote the docs.
projects.outcome: Significantly improved PHP agent installation experience for customers

projects.name: New Relic Infrastructure
projects.overview: This sample is an adapted subset of web pages from docs.newrelic.com that supported the initial launch of a foundational new product called New Relic Infrastructure, from complex install & configure to how to analyze data in the UI.
projects.challenge: This product replaced an older, more basic product called New Relic Servers. Install and configuration was complex, as it included not only monitoring the operating system, but also included "on-host integrations" to extend monitoring to other software running on the host (databases, logging, etc).
projects.approach: Configured Apache virtual hosts and developed bash scripts to generate realistic traffic patterns, populating Infrastructure monitoring dashboards with live data to validate UI behavior and capture authentic screenshots for documentation
projects.outcome: Successfully supported launch of major new product with comprehensive documentation

projects.name: How to manage New Relic public site search
projects.overview: This sample is an internal doc I wrote for content and engineering teams to manage our search results, which was part of all public New Relic site searches as well as a product UI feature called NR1 Help Center.
projects.challenge: Our search was a critical component across many different important experiences, from technical support's site (ticket deflection), to our main marketing site, to docs, to an in-product feature called NR1 Help Center. This cut across many teams who needed information on how to keep the index up to date and optimize it for their experience so customers get high value results and the help they need.
projects.outcome: Created comprehensive search management system used across multiple teams and products

projects.name: Docs website migration to custom, open source CMS
projects.overview: We migrated the documentation CMS from Drupal to an open source, content-as-code repo to provide developer and external contributor friendly contribution.
projects.challenge: We had to migrate and convert content in HTML to React based MDX components and maintain SEO and routing. We also had to completely rebuild internationalization and integrate complex translation vendor API and workflows into the repo. We had to ensure several data endpoints were preserved for downstream services / features that relied on docs data.
projects.approach: Incremental migration. Used GitHub (and GitHub Actions) and Gatsby as our site generator with content stored in markdown and MDX files.
projects.outcome: We reduced COGS by $43k / year by removing need for hosting platform.

projects.name: New Relic Help Center Prototype
projects.overview: New Relic unified its products into a singular UI and expanded monitoring capabilities. Customer training content was disparate. I developed a Help Center prototype as a React application integrated into the product UI.
projects.challenge: I needed to significantly improve my nascent React.js skills (pre-hooks, class component era). I also had to learn internal developer platform tools for application configuration, CI/CD tooling for deployments, and a custom feature flag system.
projects.approach: I created an API to retrieve data from our Drupal-based documentation site and used the Swiftype API for searching across various websites with custom filters. Content would render in context within the application upon clicking a search result.
projects.outcome: I developed a functional prototype with filtering capabilities and documentation site content rendering. This attracted CEO attention and eventually became an engineering team's roadmap feature, evolving into a comprehensive in-app help system with a technical support portal and New Relic's Ask AI feature.

projects.name: New Relic Developer Website
projects.overview: Built interactive learning platform combining in-depth tutorials with live New Relic design system components; solved distribution and rendering challenges to showcase working examples of React components with contextual learning conten.  Includes embeddable pages for reusing guides in other New Relic sites.
projects.challenge: Created comprehensive developer portal with interactive documentation and embeddable content system
projects.outcome: Full-featured developer portal with interactive SDK documentation and reusable content components

projects.name: New Relic Public Website Design System (Gatsby)
projects.overview: NPM package + demo site + component library that serves as a central website theme / component / utility library for all New Relic Gatsby sites to unify look and feel and functionality. CI/CD workflows and deployment to NPM. Includes a global header and federated search UI across all New Relic websites. Includes internationalization utilities/components.
projects.challenge: Created unified design system and component library to standardize UI/UX across multiple Gatsby sites
projects.outcome: Centralized component library enabling consistent experience across all New Relic Gatsby sites

projects.name: New Relic Open Source Program Website
projects.overview: Website to showcase New Relic's new Open Source program and catalog of open source projects. React.js based static site generated (SSG) with Gatsby. CI/CD workflows and deployment. Includes sourcing lots of GitHub data for hundreds of New Relic's open source projects.
projects.challenge: Built dynamic site showcasing hundreds of open source projects with automated GitHub data integration
projects.outcome: Marketing site successfully showcasing New Relic's open source program with automated data sourcing

projects.name: Personal Portfolio Site
projects.overview: Complete rewrite from Gatsby to Astro with component-driven architecture. Features responsive design, interactive filtering, animated Scrabble name component, and comprehensive content management system.
projects.challenge: Rewrite from Gatsby to Astro for performance quickly.
projects.outcome: Modern, performant portfolio site showcasing dual expertise in technical writing and software engineering

projects.name: wedding-website
projects.overview: Gatsby frontend site for wedding day info and to RSVP. Integrated with GraphQL API service for guest management.
projects.challenge: Built complete wedding management system with RSVP functionality and guest data management
projects.outcome: Functional wedding website with RSVP system and guest management

projects.name: wedding-website-rsvp-service
projects.overview: Backend GraphQL API service to manage and store RSVP guest info in MongoDB. Supports the wedding website frontend with complete guest management functionality.
projects.challenge: Built robust API service for managing wedding guest data with GraphQL interface
projects.outcome: Fully functional backend service supporting wedding website RSVP system

projects.name: Workout Goal Tracker UI
projects.overview: Next.js application to track workout goal progress for activities tracked in Strava. Integrates with Strava API using OAuth authentication.
projects.challenge: Built comprehensive workout tracking application with OAuth integration and goal management
projects.outcome: Functional workout tracking app with Strava API integration and OAuth authentication

projects.name: New Relic In-App Help Experience Guide
projects.overview: Guide for product managers and engineering teams on how to use the New Relic Help Experience system to provide in-context help, onboarding, feature adoption support, and self-service resources. The Help Experience delivers documentation, support, and AI assistance directly within the product UI.
projects.challenge: Product teams needed to provide contextual help, onboarding guidance, and feature discovery without taking users out of their workflow. This required building both the technical system (UI components, content management backend) and clear documentation to enable teams across the organization to contribute help content effectively.
projects.outcome: Comprehensive product documentation enabling teams to integrate contextual help throughout New Relic's UI

projects.name: Managing Context with AI Coding Assistants
projects.overview: Developer-focused guide teaching essential strategies for providing effective context to AI coding assistants like Claude Code, GitHub Copilot, and Cursor. Covers the Write-Select-Compress-Isolate framework for context management, addressing common challenges in large codebases, long debugging sessions, and multi-file development tasks.
projects.challenge: As AI coding assistants became widely adopted, developers struggled with context management in large codebasesAI would lose track of important details, make circular mistakes, or fail when context windows filled up. Teams needed practical guidance on optimizing context to ensure performance and quality in AI-generated code.
projects.outcome: Comprehensive guide providing developers with practical frameworks for effective AI-assisted development

projects.name: gatsby-plugin-newrelic
projects.overview: Gatsby plugin enabling developers to easily add New Relic's Browser agent to their Gatsby sites for tracking frontend performance. Published to NPM with ~20k downloads per week at peak adoption.
projects.challenge: Created accessible tooling for Gatsby developers to integrate New Relic's browser monitoring without complex configuration, enabling real-world performance tracking across thousands of Gatsby sites.
projects.outcome: Widely adopted plugin reaching ~20k downloads per week, enabling thousands of Gatsby sites to monitor frontend performance with New Relic

projects.name: New Relic Data Dictionary System
projects.overview: Multi-component system providing definitions for events and attributes across New Relic's platform. Included a GraphQL API service (NerdGraph), public data catalog UI on docs site, and in-product UI tooltips in dashboards and various product views. Helped users understand data measurements, units, calculations, and context.
projects.challenge: Designed content data storage architecture and delivery system to serve multiple consuming teams and interfaces. Later rearchitected the entire system for better maintainability while supporting critical user experience across docs, product UI, and API.
projects.outcome: Widely adopted internal system viewed as very helpful by users, enabling data comprehension across dashboards, charts, and query interfaces throughout New Relic's product

projects.name: New Relic In-App Help System
projects.overview: Led cross-functional engineering initiative to transform a React prototype into a scalable in-app help system, enabling content teams to author and manage help documentation directly within New Relic's unified product UI.
projects.challenge: Create a custom CMS solution that worked within New Relic's stateless, multi-cell architecture while solving three key problems: content-to-UI association across micro-frontends, pre-production content previews, and a deployment strategy for database-free content stored in Node.js runtime.
projects.approach: Leveraged MDX files in GitHub Enterprise for content storage, familiar to writing teams. Built a Node.js service that rebuilt on content changes and exposed content via NerdGraph API. Enhanced the React app with search, support integration, and AskAI features. Created an admin dashboard for writers to access page metadata, streamlining content-to-view associations. Collaborated with platform engineering to enable app state management and developed reusable components for product teams to embed contextual help.

projects.name: Develop embeddable developer tutorial content
projects.overview: Architected and developed an embeddable tutorial feature for the New Relic developer website using Gatsby and MDX that enabled the training team to integrate interactive, up-to-date technical content directly into their paid training curriculum. Transformed the maintenance burden of outdated training materials into a scalable, component-based documentation system that improved customer onboarding and product adoption by providing hands-on, contextual learning experiences for paying training customers.
projects.challenge: Diagnosed and resolved Content Security Policy violations preventing iframe embeds from loading in training browsers by implementing appropriate CSP headers and frame-ancestors directives, enabling secure cross-origin content delivery. Engineered flicker-free dark/light mode support for embedded tutorials by optimizing SSR hydration and implementing pre-render theme detection, ensuring seamless visual integration with host training environments.
